name: a(n) = 3^(n-2)*(binomial(n,2) + 3*n + 9).
comment: a(n) is the number of words of length n defined on 4 letters where a chosen letter (for example, the first letter of the alphabet) is used at most twice.
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (9,-27,27).
example: a(4) = 243 since from the 256 words defined on {0, 1, 2, 3} we subtract the 4 words of type 0001, the 4 words of type 0002, the 4 words of type 0003, and 0000.
author: _Enrique Navarrete_, Apr 01 2025

name: a(n) = 90*binomial(n,6) + 90*binomial(n,5) + 54*binomial(n,4) + 24*binomial(n,3) + 9*binomial(n,2) + 3*n + 1.
comment: a(n) is the number of words of length n defined on 4 symbols where three chosen symbols (say, the three largest ones) are used at most twice.
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (7,-21,35,-35,21,-7,1).
example: a(3) = 61 since from the 64 words defined on {0, 1, 2, 3} we subtract the three words 111, 222, 333.
author: _Enrique Navarrete_, Apr 01 2025
